args:
Lily and Victor arrive at a lakeside village,
only to find the lake filled with fiends by the
empire as part of an occupation scheme.
Lily puts an end to this by freezing the lake
and saving the village.
According to the map\n{player_name} gave us,\nthis should be the spot.
Whoa, this lake is HUGE! And I\ncan see a town on the other side!
Ore rich in water mana can be mined\nin this area because of the lake.
The imperial army is planning to build\na fortress where that village stands in\norder to harvest it.
Are you sure? I can't see any\nsoldiers anywhere.
The only viable way to access the village\nis across the lake, as it's surrounded by\nsteep mountains on all other sides.
The imperial army would need to sail\nover to attack it—an arduous task indeed.
So this village is safe, then. Does that\nmean what {player_name} told\nus is wrong?
His information is accurate. The army\nis just attempting to achieve their goal\nwithout a direct assault.
Aah! What's that sound?\nIt's coming from the lake!
Exactly. The army released fiends\ninto the lake.
And with said danger looming, the\nresidents are effectively under lockdown.\nEventually, they'll run out of food.
That's AWFUL!\nWe've gotta do something for them!
I agree. But first, we need a plan.
Don't get too close to the lake.\nIt's dangero—
The lake is turning to ice!
Hee hee! Now it's frozen solid.\nNo fiend is getting out of that!
We can walk across it now, too.\nSo let's go help everyone—\nand give them their presents!
But what's with all the commotion?
The villagers just witnessed an\nentire lake freeze before their eyes.\nI would think their surprise only natural.
All she did was touch the water, and\nBOOM: frozen! That was AWESOME!
With all those fiends, we couldn't even\nleave our homes, let alone go fishing.\nI thought we were going to starve.
You are the savior of this village,\nyoung lady!
Wait... Are you the real Saint Starfall?!
Hee hee, yup! And now that\nwe're here, Dragonyule is saved!
We even brought presents for everyone!\nHere you go!
That night, at the village inn...
It's past your bedtime, young lady.
I'm just so excited and happy that\nI can't get to sleep.
I have to say, you were mighty impressive\ntoday. I couldn't have saved this village\nwithout you.
Aw! Thank you. I'm just glad they'll all\nbe able to celebrate Dragonyule now.
You talk about Dragonyule more\nthan anyone I've ever known.\nYou must really like it.
There's more to it than that.\nIt's a super important time for my\npeople, the crystalia.
That name sounds familiar. If I'm not\nmistaken, they're a tribe from a snowy\nregion with the power to manipulate cold.
That certainly explains how you were\nable to freeze that lake...and why you\nlack knowledge about the outside world.
In my village, whenever Dragonyule comes\naround, we hold the ice crystal ceremony.
It's a special day when we pray\nthat Dragonyule will be a happy\ntime for everyone.
We make snow fall, too.\nI've got so many memories of it!
I might be away from my village right\nnow, but that doesn't change who I am.
That's why I can't forgive the empire for\ntrying to ruin such a special holiday!
(She might be young, but I see she's still\nholding onto some pretty strong desires.)
*yawn* All this talking's made me sleepy.
Don't fall asleep here!\nYou need to be in bed!
(Here I thought this whole excursion was\nme being used as a glorified babysitter.)
(But there is nothing childish in Lily's\nsense of duty to protect Dragonyule.)
(I can't make light of her resolve.)
Commander! The lake really is frozen!
Excellent. Then our path is open.
